title: The Way of the Righteous
shortSummary: Psalm 1 contrasts the life paths of the righteous and the ungodly, emphasizing the blessings that come from delighting in God's law and meditating on it continually. It sets the tone for the entire Psalter by highlighting the prosperity and stability of those who follow God's ways versus the ultimate destruction of the wicked.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - United Monarchy period, traditionally attributed to King David

keyCharacters.name: The Righteous Man
keyCharacters.description: A person who delights in and meditates on the law of the LORD, avoiding the counsel and company of the ungodly.

keyCharacters.name: The Ungodly
keyCharacters.description: Those who reject God's law and follow sinful ways, ultimately destined for judgment and destruction.

definitions.definition: Those who live without regard for God’s law, often characterized by sinful behavior and opposition to righteousness.
To deeply reflect on and ponder God’s Word, allowing it to shape one’s thoughts and actions continually.
The worthless husks separated from grain by the wind, symbolizing the instability and worthlessness of the ungodly.
Advice or guidance; here it refers to the influence or teaching that one follows in life.

outline.heading: The Blessedness of the Righteous Man
outline.description: Describes the blessed state of the man who avoids sinful influences and delights in God’s law, meditating on it day and night.

outline.heading: The Stability and Prosperity of the Righteous
outline.description: Illustrates the righteous as a fruitful tree planted by water, symbolizing spiritual vitality, growth, and success in God’s timing.

outline.heading: The Fate of the Ungodly
outline.description: Contrasts the ungodly with the righteous, comparing them to chaff blown away by the wind and declaring their inability to stand in judgment.

outline.heading: The Lord’s Knowledge and Judgment
outline.description: Affirms that God intimately knows the way of the righteous and that the path of the ungodly leads to destruction.

application: Avoid the influence and company of those who promote ungodliness; choose your associations wisely to protect your spiritual walk.
Delight in God’s Word daily and meditate on it continually to grow in wisdom and spiritual strength.
Trust in God’s promise that obedience leads to stability and prosperity, even in difficult seasons.
Remember that God judges righteously and that the ultimate destiny of the wicked is destruction, motivating holy living.

keyVerses.text: Blessed is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the ungodly, nor standeth in the way of sinners, nor sitteth in the seat of the scornful.
keyVerses.significance: This verse sets the foundation for righteous living by emphasizing the importance of avoiding sinful influences.

keyVerses.text: But his delight is in the law of the LORD; and in his law doth he meditate day and night.
keyVerses.significance: Highlights the key spiritual discipline of meditating on God’s Word as the source of true blessing.

keyVerses.text: And he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, that bringeth forth his fruit in his season; his leaf also shall not wither; and whatsoever he doeth shall prosper.
keyVerses.significance: Illustrates the flourishing and fruitful life that results from steadfastness in God’s Word.

keyVerses.text: For the LORD knoweth the way of the righteous: but the way of the ungodly shall perish.
keyVerses.significance: Assures believers of God’s intimate knowledge and care for the righteous and warns of the destruction awaiting the wicked.
